page.title: 18A BANK MANAGER'S DAY AT WORK
page.content:
The manager arrives for work at 9 a.m. The staff have already arrived.His first job is to look through the morning post. He will deal with any problems until 9.15. Next he will look at his computer listings to see which accounts are overdrawn. Then he will see perhaps two customers.
He goes home for dinner at 1 p.m. Only a few bank managers can go home for dinner as most live too far away. After dinner he might go to see one of his farmer customers and look around his farm.
He leaves the bank at about 5 p.m. Most of his paper work is done at home instead of at the bank when the staff have gone home.
